content: Just to make it clear I am writing a review on the gym and not the hotel. I have been a gym member for the past two years. I became a member because the manager insured me that they don't allow aggressive people to enrol. Two years after and the place is full of groups of angry,  disgusting and loud men who talk on the phone in the workout areas, throw their towels everywhere on the floor, put their dirty shoes on the benches in the locker rooms, and sometimes even train with their jeans on. And don't get me started on the sauna area. Women don't feel safe in there, believe me. The staff is always helpful and polite though, the training equipment is new and of high quality. The problem I see is mainly the low quality and lack of manners of many of the new members. If I am paying all this money, then I need to feel safe and protected in the place I come to relax and train. I've just cancelled my membership...
owner_reply:
(Translated by Google) Good evening Gerry, thank you for your review and for raising your concerns. I am very sorry that you experienced situations that made you uncomfortable. My team and I are on site during opening hours and are happy to take direct advice. Of course, it is unfortunate that there are a few members in our house who do not follow the club's etiquette and would be grateful for any information. Day and time are sufficient to pursue your points in order to narrow down the individual persons / groups. My team and I would be very happy to talk to you personally and would be very grateful if you took the opportunity to leave more specific information at the Membership Service or by email: blnmemberservice@aspria.de or Management Sandra Schmalzried, since in the last few months there has been little or no concrete feedback on the points you mentioned.
However, I also noticed the positive aspects and thank you for mentioning them in your feedback. I'm not sure who gave you the assurance of pre-identifying and denying members who are misbehaving, but I can assure you that we will follow up on any leads to provide our members and guests with a place to relax at the club.

With a warm greeting from the Aspria
Sandra Schmalzried
General manager

content:
The hotel would be great but the service is terrible. It‚Äôs not what you expect when traveling.
As other comments said, breakfast isn‚Äôt worth it at all. It is the first time I see such a poor service for this price. You can only choose between croissants, 1 type of bread, 1 type of yogurt, 1 small fruit salade: that‚Äôs not what you expect when going in an hotel.
Room is good but it wasn‚Äôt cleaned up when I came back at 5:30pm.

I booked the deluxe room accessible. The staff/personel were very hulpfull in all things asked.
The room was comfortably big.
My only suggestions:
Get a power point next to your bed
Get the service call next to your bed.
Remember a disabled often can't walk at night to the suggestions written above,
The TV is great. However make it digital, if you decide to stay in the hotel you would like to watch a movie or tv on demand,from your bed. Adding for example Netflix,HBO or Disney etc. 1 is enough! After the gym and spa relax in bed time!
Nice facility, cool trainers horrible reception. Definitely not worth the money they charge for
owner_reply:
Thank you for your feedback and luckily our core product (equipment, variety, trainers) as a wellbeing club has met your expectations. Sorry, that your experience at reception has not been to your satisfaction and will work on this one for next time. 
Best wishes,
Sandra Schmalzried
General Manager
Aspria Berlin

content: Stayed here for one night. The hotel rooms in a gym/spa concept is weird but it worked very well for me to have access to a nice sauna area!

The fitness options are great and were my main reason to choose this stay but the hotel service itself is really not worth the price. The room service isn‚Äôt really cleaning the place, you can‚Äôt get a water cooker like in every normal hotel in your room, also no coffee before 6 and the furniture is making a cracking noise which is really annoying when you are trying to sleep.
The best sport/family/social club in Berlin. I ü´∂üèº Aspria forever.

content:
For business I was staying at Aspria Ku‚Äôdamm Berlin for 12 nights and I really started to wonder whether the Aspria is really a hotel. I‚Äôve come to the conclusion it‚Äôs just a side-business for the Wellness Aspria. (Need Sherlock Holmes to book a room on their website).

During a stay of 12 nights:
* the bed was made every day but the sheets were never replaced.
* they never vacuumed the room
* when I mentioned this at checking out, the only reaction was "oh, we'll let
housecleaning know" No form of appology. Staff didn't seem to care.

After 8pm it's impossible to sit at the bar and order coffee or any other drink

Getting the right bill was also quite a puzzle with items of another guest.

My experience:
The location: Although the street of the hotel is not really appealing, it‚Äôs reasonably quiet and only a few hundred meters from the Kurf√ºrstendamm, where there are plenty of restaurants, supermarket and other stores (the Greek restaurant Ach! Niko ? Ach is very recommendable). Also the S-Bahn Charlottenburg is only about 7 minutes walk away. The hotel has a parking garage, so for a visit to Berlin a fine location.

My arrival at the hotel was a real Benny Hill experience. The only thing missing was the Benny Hill tune‚Ä¶ I was given room 111 and when I came first to this room the keycard didn‚Äôt work. So, a little frustrated I went back to reception. The receptionist reactivated the card and kindly joined me upstairs to the room and the key did work. Then the WIFI code didn't seem to work. Back at reception I was given a code that worked.

The first morning I went to breakfast, which was fairly simple. For 14 euro‚Äôs you can choose from 2 kinds of tasty fresh bread and croissants, 2 kinds of blandly tasting cheese, Nutella, jelly, (boiled and baked) eggs and some yoghurt. Plenty of choices for coffee, tea and hot chocolate, but I cannot say the cappucino or Latte Macchiato had a great taste.
When I mentioned my room number at the breakfast staff, it wasn‚Äôt on the list. Well, according to the list I was in another room: 112. They‚Äôd check with reception. When I came back later I had to ask, but was told that everything was in order.  The list was correct‚Ä¶
Well, lets check with reception‚Ä¶ First I complained about the noisy bed in my room 111. Then checked why breakfast staff thinks I am in 112. ‚ÄúBut you are in 112‚Äù was the answer. We have guests arriving in 111 today. NO, I slept in 111, my stuff is in 111, so how can I be in 112 then? So I proposed they‚Äôd give me the key for 112 so I could move my stuff from 111 to 112 (this also solved my noisy bed issue). They gave me the keycard for 112, but at room 112 the keycard didn‚Äôt work‚Ä¶ Grrrr.
Back to friendly receptionist to get it solved.
In room 112 the bed was fine. Basically the room looked fine, although the long pile carpet was not exactly cleaned well. I guess they‚Äôd never vacuum here. Also cleaning the bed. I was here for 12 nights and the only thing they did was shaking up the pillow and folding the blanket, but never cleaned the bed, nor vacuum the room. I know this because of the visible loose fibers on the carpet that a vacuum cleaner definitely would have cleared. A little stain in the bed that was there the first day has been there during my entire stay. Cleaning your room is not a priority in this hotel. You get clean towels and fold the toilet paper, but I guess that's it.
Also the bed is a bit strange. The bed header is not straight so there is a big gap between the comfortable matrass and the header. The small pillow fills the gap entirely. If you, like me always push your pillow to the header when you sleep, it‚Äôs a bit uncomfortable.
Next, the shower‚Ä¶ The door to the toilet/shower closes the shower nicely, keeping the toilet and the show separated. Clever‚Ä¶ So I thought‚Ä¶ But the gap, which is the result at the hinge side is huge, so the water splashes and gushes through that side. One big plus is the shower head itself. One word: F A N T A S T I C! I've never had such nice powerful and comfortable shower before in a hotel. That‚Äôs a keeper for sure.
Had a great stay overnight, the saunas are awesome
owner_reply:
That sounds like a perfect stay. Thank you for taking the time letting us know.

Love to welcome you again,
sincerely
Sandra Schmalzried
General Manager
Aspria Berlin

content: No water fountains, no transparency on rates, and unfriendly gym staff (I was scolded for using more than one big towel for swimming + sauna). Ultimately it‚Äôs not well-suited for international guests.

Judging hotel and restaurant only, haven't used spa or fitness center.
Rooms are pretty spacious and quiet. Useful thing - they put a sink outside the bath (shower/bath & toilet).
Very nice choice of healthy dishes. Unfortunately not much beer too choose from.
Service very friendly and helpful.

Make sure you use the many different excellent saunas. There is a big pool and fitness facility. Breakfast is good and its quiet at night. Great place for business people, who want to use their spare time to exercise or sauna. Rooms and beds are very good, 2 niggles though: a very high bath tub, which is not easy to get in if you just want to use it for shower; when you go to loo at night you probably will wake your partner, as the light goes also on in changing cum sink room, which is only partitioned by a wall that doesn't do up to sealing
owner_reply: Thank you Susan for your kind feedback! We are looking forward to welcoming you back at Aspria soon.

content:
Amazing sports facilities and central location. Rooms are modern and clean.
This hotel is perfect if you want to visit Berlin but also spend some hours doing sports & wellness.

Just a short walk off the main road, this hotel is a conveniently located choice for travelers who want to maintain fitness while traveling. A lot of hotels in this area do not have a gym so Aspria is definitely my top pick. Their fitness and wellness facilities are one of the best in the area; several floors dedicated to weight training, cardio, yoga, swimming. The breakfast buffet is healthy and delicious too.
owner_reply: Thank you so much Evany for your Kind review! We are very glad to hear that Aspria is your top choice when travelling. We are looking forward to having you back with us soon!

content: At the beginning I was happy with the warm welcoming and the services offered by the club, I was told that I will receive communications in English but once I was in the club, all the communications received were in German except 1 email, after a few months, I didn't receive any feedback from the club after emails and emails asking and asking, it seems that they just ignored any communication. I will recommend the club if you are German sepaker. Unfortunately, after 0 feedback I will request to leave the club.

The facilities are fantastic: very modern, everything you need is here and it's not too crowded. The hotel seems to be a bit less advertised but I really enjoyed the rooms (they're huge, very clean and modern, good wifi, only the TV reminds you of the 90s). The location isn't super central, but you can still find a few restaurants and bars nearby.

Not a typical Hotel. Focused on their gym members and some staff isnt use to "Hotel Demands or Standards".
AC did not work properly in the heat and no alternative solution was found....
Overall impression was ok, far from Mindblowing

good location, great spa and fitness, and super symphatic specialist who understand them work. Personal nice, just when u wanna finish your contract they are not nice anymore ;-) and the woman by the towels is not nice at all, when u pay 220 euro for first month at gym u go first day, anybody tell u u can get only 2 towels for free so u take 3 cause u wanna go to sauna as well and the lady there start jelling at u that u have to pay 0,50 euro more

I had a day ticket. I am not a member. The massage was shorter than booked but i got a coupon as gift. When you dont know the place you are a little bit lost. You must find personel to ask for help. There is a lot of fitness posibillities available. They have one pool and also sauna. When you ask for a membership plan you get no clear info. You will get an individual contract. Nice place
owner_reply: Thank you Marco for your kind words! If you are interested in becoming a member I would love to get you in touch with one of my colleagues from our Membership Team. Kind regards, Maria

content:
I do not recommend this so-called high-end Gym/Spa to anyone else other than the Nouveau Riche bling gang of a certain ethnic group in this city and country, whose rude and coarse behaviours are well-documented and known amongst the locals and expats alike.
Stay away if you consider yourself a cultured, respectable and refined person who expects a chill, relaxed atmosphere commensurate with the top-euro you pay for the membership in this place. Underneath the staged veil of exclusivity is a club open to all who's willing to shell out 140 a month, no question asked, no background checked.
I've had some horrible experiences in the past month or so. Noone re-racks, first of all. The gym etiquette here is non-existent, but that's actually what bothers me the least.
A few young male members of the aforementioned certain ethnic group are certainly not used to seeing foreigners of a complexion other than white or brown, and they like to stare in a very coarse and unfriendly, if not downright aggressive way. You'd think this is a refugee camp when you see eyes like this, not a fancy clubhouse of 'guests of esteem'.
The first week I was in Aspria I saw 1 of them spitting on the floor of the weight room while lifting a pair of dumbbells, with no shame or whatsoever, and I immediately reported it to the management. Just yesterday, in the same workout area, I was heading into the bathroom where I bumped into the same young man, about to finish his business in front of the urinal, made a loud hulking sound followed by a dramatic spitting endeavour that resulted in having his nasty slime splashed across a large area of the wall behind the urinal. I took a picture of it as proof.
All said, if you have a thick skin and are willing to ignore or suffer through all the rudeness and unfriendliness (from certain guests not from the staff) associated with this place, they do have quite decent gym equipment and spa area.
Very nice rooms. Warm welcome for the staff. Amazing sports facilities. Breakfast is ok, good quality but not a huge choice. Recommended

content:
(Translated by Google) I was in Berlin for 2 nights on a weekend for business and this time I chose the Aspria to have sports and sauna facilities.
When I arrived shortly after 6 p.m., the first thing I came across was the notice that the training/spa area would be closed from 6 p.m. due to the internal Christmas party. Since I had booked the stay because of these possibilities, I would have been happy about a previous email or a voucher. Then I could have planned my stay differently. Unfortunately, there was no information about this on the homepage.
Unfortunately, when I arrived I was not informed that the Christmas party was taking place in the inner courtyard - for which I was given a room. Since I had to give a seminar the next day and wanted to be well rested, I asked around 9:30 p.m. for a room facing the street. (This is actually very quiet, since there is no main road.) The employee kindly offered me an alternative room. However, her supervisor(?) intervened and assured me that the party would only last until 10 p.m., max. 10:30 p.m. Is that okay? she will then surely send all the guests of the celebration home. That was fine with me, of course, I'm not particularly picky about it and I found changing rooms to be a hassle. The party wasn't over at 10:30 p.m. as promised... Instead, the music was turned up again from midnight to such an extent that even with noise-cancelling headphones, sleep was no longer an option. I called the front desk; the employee on night duty seemed overwhelmed by my request that I "feel free to contact the early shift the next morning". I made it clear again that his colleague had already found me another room, so that I could finally move around 1 a.m. and after a longer discussion.
It's great that I was able to change rooms. However, the situation could have been more relaxed for everyone involved if I had been asked at check-in whether I wanted a room facing the street or the inner courtyard. The obvious lie of the superiors is completely unacceptable in my opinion - customers should never be sold as stupid.

Another "experience" at check-in was the behavior of another employee, probably also a manager, who argued with three guests in front of everyone else. They apparently wanted to redeem a day ticket and were also annoyed that it was closed from 6 p.m. In my opinion, the women were right to complain and they were all friendly, even though the employee blamed them for everything. He insisted that guests "have a duty to find out whether it's open or not; after all, the notices have been up for weeks". It may be, however, that the ladies stated that they had been there for the first time that day and were therefore not able to see the notices earlier.
I myself have worked in the catering/hotel industry for several years and stay about 1x per week in various hotels. I have never seen such rude behavior from a manager. Not customer oriented at all.

I would like to emphasize that the other employees were friendly and tried hard (especially the cleaning staff on the training area!), However, e.g. T. not well trained/acting overwhelmed. The training facilities are good and the area is clean. The rooms are extremely noisy; even the water tap in the next room can be heard. The breakfast had a small and good selection. As a woman, I felt very uncomfortable in the spa; the 90% men examined me extensively. The women's sauna is great, but I didn't want to use the relaxation area afterwards. The floor is also extremely slippery with the hotel slippers. I was able to catch myself several times - this can be extremely dangerous for unsportsmanlike or older people. Hotel location is good.

(Original)
Ich war an einem Wochenende f√ºr 2 N√§chte beruflich in Berlin und hatte dieses Mal das Aspria gew√§hlt, um Sport- und Saunam√∂glichkeiten zu haben.
Bei der Ankunft um kurz nach 18 Uhr stie√ü ich als erstes auf den Aushang, dass aufgrund der internen Weihnachtsfeier der Trainings-/Spa-Bereich ab 18 Uhr geschlossen sei. Da ich aufgrund  dieser M√∂glichkeiten den Aufenthalt gebucht hatte, h√§tte ich mich √ºber eine vorherige Email oder einen Gutschein gefreut. Dann h√§tte ich meinen Aufenthalt anders planen k√∂nnen. Auf der Homepage war leider vorab keine Info dazu zu finden.
Bei der Ankunft wurde mir leider auch nicht mitgeteilt, dass die Weihnachtsfeier im Innenhof stattfindet - zu dem ich ein Zimmer erhalten habe. Da ich am n√§chsten Tag ein Seminar geben musste und entsprechend ausgeschlafen sein wollte, bat ich gegen 21:30 Uhr darum, ein Zimmer zur Stra√üe zu erhalten. (Diese ist tats√§chlich sehr ruhig, da keine Hauptverkehrsstra√üe.) Die Mitarbeiterin bot mir freundlicherweise direkt ein alternatives Zimmer an. Ihre Vorgesetzte(?) schaltete sich dann jedoch ein und versicherte mir, dass die Party nur bis 22 Uhr, max. 22:30 gehe. Ob das in Ordnung sei; sie schicke dann sicher alle G√§ste der Feier nach Hause. Das war f√ºr mich selbstverst√§ndlich in Ordnung, sonderlich kleinlich bin ich da nicht und einen Zimmerwechsel fand ich selbst auch aufwendig. Die Party war dann nicht wie versichert um 22:30 Uhr vorbei... Stattdessen wurde ab Mitternacht die Musik nochmal derart aufgedreht, dass auch mit Noise-Cancelling-Kopfh√∂rern nicht mehr an Schlaf zu denken war. Ich rief die Rezeption an; der Mitarbeiter in Nachtbereitschaft wirkte mit meinem Anliegen √ºberfordert, ich k√∂nne mich "gerne am n√§chsten Morgen an den Fr√ºhdienst wenden". Ich machte nochmal deutlich, dass mir seine Kollegin bereits ein anderes Zimmer rausgesucht hatte, sodass ich dann schlie√ülich gegen 1 Uhr und l√§ngerer Diskussion umziehen konnte.
Toll ist, dass ich das Zimmer noch wechseln konnte. Allerdings h√§tte die Situation f√ºr alle Beteiligten entspannter verlaufen k√∂nnen, w√§re ich bereits beim Check gefragt worden, ob ich ein Zimmer zur Stra√üe oder zum Innenhof wolle. Die offensichtliche L√ºge der Vorgesetzten ist m. E. vollkommen inakzeptabel - Kund:innen sollten niemals als dumm verkauft werden.

Ein weiteres "Erlebnis" beim Check in war das Verhalten eines anderen Mitarbeiters, vermutlich ebenfalls Vorgesetzten, der sich mit drei G√§sten vor allen anderen stritt. Diese wollten scheinbar eine Tageskarte einl√∂sen und waren ebenfalls ver√§rgert dar√ºber, dass bereits ab 18 Uhr geschlossen sei. Die Frauen haben sich m. E. vollkommen zurecht beschwert und waren durchweg freundlich, obwohl der Mitarbeiter ihnen s√§mtliche Schuld zuwies. Er beharrte auf seiner Meinung, dass G√§ste "in der Pflicht sind, sich dar√ºber zu informieren, ob ge√∂ffnet ist oder nicht; die Aush√§nge h√§ngen ja schlie√ülich schon seit Wochen". Mag sein, die Damen √§u√üerten allerdings, an dem Tag das erste Mal dort gewesen zu sein und haben die Aush√§nge daher nicht eher sehen k√∂nnen.
Ich habe selbst mehrere Jahre im Gastro-/Hotel-Gewerbe gearbeitet und √ºbernachte ca. 1x/Woche in verschiedensten Hotels. So ein unversch√§mtes Verhalten eines Vorgesetzten ist mir bisher noch nicht untergekommen. Keineswegs kundenorientiert.

Betonen m√∂chte ich, dass die anderen Mitarbeitenden freundlich und bem√ºht waren (insb. das Reinigungspersonal auf der Trainingsfl√§che!), allerdings z. T. nicht gut geschult/√ºberfordert wirkend. Die Trainingsm√∂glichkeiten sind gut, die Fl√§che sauber. Die Zimmer sind extrem hellh√∂rig; selbst der Wasserhahn des Nachbarzimmers ist zu h√∂ren. Das Fr√ºhst√ºck hatte eine kleine und gute Auswahl. Im Spa habe ich mich als Frau sehr unwohl gef√ºhlt; die 90% M√§nner haben mich ausgiebig begutachtet. Die Damensauna ist super, aber den Ruhebereich danach wollte ich daher nicht mehr nutzen. Der Boden ist au√üerdem extrem rutschig mit den Hotelschlappen. Ich habe mich mehrmals grad noch abfangen k√∂nnen - f√ºr unsportliche oder √§ltere Personen kann das extrem gef√§hrlich werden. Lage des Hotels ist gut.

(Translated by Google) Can confirm (almost) all of the positive reviews and do not want to repeat the texts. We stayed at the Aspria for two nights and our expectations were not only met, they were exceeded. We especially liked the nice and friendly service. We have not found anything like this in other hotels. Thank you Mr. Putschke for the excellent food that was served to us in the bistro.
Gladly again and again üòä.

(Original)
Kann die positiven Rezessionen (fast) alle best√§tigen und m√∂chte die Texte nicht wiederholen. Wir waren f√ºr zwei N√§chte im Aspria und unsere Erwartungshaltung wurde nicht nur erf√ºllt, sondern √ºbertroffen.  Besonders der nette und freundliche Service, hat uns sehr, sehr gut gefallen. So etwas haben wir in anderen Hotels bisher nicht vorgefunden. Danke Herr Putschke, f√ºr das exzellente Essen welches uns im Bistro serviert wurde.

(Translated by Google) I was given a voucher for this location. So I thought to myself, I should book a massage and let me show me the place.
I am pleasantly surprised:
Booking online with the voucher was problematic, but I was immediately offered help via email and the voucher was offset against the remaining balance on site.
Here is my more detailed evaluation:
1. Nice place with an inviting reception area, easy to reach by public transport and on foot.
2. All employees, and I saw some of them during the tour and experienced them live, were friendly and positive (despite bad weather).
3. The booked massage (60 min.) Took place in an appealing ambience (light, room temperature, fragrance, music) with a very high standard of hygiene. The masseur was an absolute professional. One of the best massages in a long time ... my recommendation: book with James. To be able to leave a massage relaxed and energetic at the same time is really something special. Thanks for that!!!
4. When I asked, someone was sent to me within a few minutes who explicitly took the time to introduce me to the club. I got a very competent guide. All my questions were answered competently and the membership for me and my children was explained transparently.
I was given a business card so that I can think in peace and then contact the nice gentleman directly. Thank you Mr. Mieth for the informative tour.

All in all: Membership seems worthwhile (of course only for those who can afford it and / or who use the wide range of offers several times a week), because the atmosphere, at least on weekdays, was consistently positive and pleasant. I felt welcome and will definitely be back.

(Translated by Google) The Aspira is one of the more expensive fitness and sports locations in Berlin. In my opinion it belongs in a row with Holme's Place and David Lloyd Meridian Berlin Spandau Arcaden. I leave out the adjoining hotel because I can't judge it. In comparison to the two competitors, however, it certainly establishes a unique selling point.
The fitness room is spacious enough. The number of courses is high with a diverse, differentiated offer. I think the number of saunas (4) is a bit too small, in comparison: the Meridian has 7. I also don't like the swimming pool as much, it reminds me of a corrugated iron garage. A plus is the outdoor area with "real" greenery.
Overall quite recommendable.

content:
(Translated by Google) I'll start with the positives because there wasn't a lot of positives. We liked the room size and facilities. The pool was also quite OK. Use of the spa and fitness area included.
Now for the negative:
1. Check-in took a long time due to preferential treatment for club members.
2. No information on the homepage or when checking in that the in-house restaurant is currently closed. This was very annoying because we thought we could have something to eat at the hotel after a 6 hour drive. The bistro didn't even have small snacks ready. When we asked where we could get something, we were only given one fancy restaurant. Then we looked for it ourselves.
3. The room was not 100% cleaned. I had complained about this and they apologized. For this inconvenience, I got a free breakfast for the day of departure, which I didn't want. (The point follows immediately.) It was then cleaned again, but only 50% of the defects were eliminated. I didn't bother the staff with this again because I didn't want to risk a 2nd breakfast.
4. Breakfast was continental. But even with a continental breakfast we would like to prepare the rolls ourselves. It's actually also the case in other hotels, despite Corona. Here you only got "a" somewhat older sandwich (there was a lot of topping on it, but less is often more). You could also get natural yoghurt and fruit salad. The fruit salad was no longer fresh, the fruit was probably cut the day before. The latte macchiato was lukewarm. You could have gotten 'a' croissant with jam and egg, but we preferred not to.
5. The spa area is located on different floors. We found this very cumbersome. You also had to register to use it, which is actually not a problem if you inform the guest either on the homepage or at the latest when they check in. We only used the pool. For the use of the spa including the pool, each guest was allowed to get 2 towels from housekeeping. All club members took 2-6 towels with them, nothing was said about that. We got our 2 and were asked if we didn't have enough towels in the room. As a hotel guest, you also had a bathrobe in your room, which unfortunately is only designed for slim people. Too bad. We would have liked to have used the jacuzzi, but unfortunately it is on a different floor. You can only use it without clothes. That's not a problem for me, but naked under a bathrobe that's too tight and offers all the insights because you can hardly do it, across the corridors? No, you don't want that.
6. As already mentioned, all facilities are spread over the floors. Even if you just want to go to your room, you have to change elevators and walk straight through the spa area. It's all very cumbersome.
7. Criticism is generally ignored by the staff, only when it came to cleaning, you had an ear, but only half.
8. It felt like if you were "only" a hotel guest, there was no or hardly any service. There could still be some work done on that.

(Original)
Ich fange mal mit dem Positiven an, denn es gab nicht viel positives. Die Zimmergr√∂√üe und Ausstattung hat uns gut gefallen. Der Pool war auch ganz OK. Nutzung des Spa- und Fitnessbereichs inklusive.
Jetzt zum Negativen:
1. Das Einchecken dauerte sehr lange, weil Clubmitglieder bevorzugt wurden.
2. Keine Infos auf der Homepage oder beim einchecken, dass das im Haus befindliche Restaurant zur Zeit geschlossen ist.  Dieses war sehr √§rgerlich, weil wir dachten wir k√∂nnten nach 6 Stunden Fahrt etwas im Hotel essen. Auch das Bistro hielt nicht einmal kleine Snacks bereit. Auf Nachfrage, wo man denn etwas bekommen k√∂nnte,  wurde uns nur ein Nobelrestaurant genannt. Wir haben dann selber gesucht.
3. Das Zimmer war nicht zu 100% gereinigt. Ich hatte dieses bem√§ngelt und man entschuldigte sich. Ich bekam f√ºr diese Unannehm- lichkeit f√ºr den  Abreisetag ein kostenloses Fr√ºhst√ºck, welches ich aber nicht wollte. (Dazu folgt gleich der Punkt.) Es wurde dann auch noch einmal geputzt, aber die M√§ngel nur zu 50 % beseitigt. Ich habe das Personal nicht noch einmal damit behelligt, weil ich kein 2. Fr√ºhst√ºck riskieren wollte.
4. Das Fr√ºhst√ºck war ein kontinentales Fr√ºhst√ºck. Aber auch bei einem kontinentalen Fr√ºhst√ºck m√∂chten wir uns das/die Br√∂tchen selber zubereiten. Ist eigentlich auch in anderen Hotels so gegeben, trotz Corona. Hier bekam man aber nur "ein" etwas √§lteres belegtes Br√∂tchen (es war zwar viel Belag drauf, aber weniger ist oft mehr). Dazu konnte man Naturjoghurt und Obstsalat bekommen. Der Obstsalat war nicht mehr frisch, vermutlich wurde das Obst schon am Vortag geschnitten. Der Latte Macchiato war lauwarm. Man h√§tte dann noch "ein' Croissant mit Marmelade und Ei bekommen k√∂nnen, aber wir verzichteten lieber.
5. Der Spa Bereich ist auf unterschiedlichen Etagen angesiedelt. Dieses fanden wir sehr umst√§ndlich. Ausserdem musste man sich f√ºr die Nutzung anmelden, was eigentlich ja auch kein Problem ist, wenn man den Gast entweder schon auf der Homepage oder sp√§testens beim einchecken darauf hinweist. Wir haben lediglich den Pool genutzt. F√ºr die Nutzung des Spa's incl. Pool durfte sich jeder Gast 2 Handt√ºcher vom Housekeeping holen. S√§mtlich Clubmitglieder nahmen 2 - 6 Handt√ºcher mit, dazu wurde nichts gesagt. Wir holten uns unsere 2 und wurden angesprochen,  ob wir nicht genug Handt√ºcher auf dem Zimmer h√§tten. Man hatte als Hotelgast auch einen Bademantel auf dem Zimmer, welcher leider wohl nur f√ºr schlanke Menschen ausgelegt ist. Schade. Wir h√§tten auch gerne den Whirlpool genutzt, aber leider befindet sich dieser auf einer anderen Etage. Diesen darf man auch nur unbekleidet nutzen. Das stellt f√ºr mich kein Problem dar, aber nackt unter einem zu engen Bademantel der s√§mtliche Einblicke bietet, da man ihn kaum zu machen kann, √ºber die Flure? Nein das will man nicht.
6. Wie schon erw√§hnt sind s√§mtliche Einrichtungen auf den Etagen verteilt.  Selbst wenn man nur auf sein Zimmer m√∂chte,  muss man den Fahrstuhl wechseln und quer durch den Spabereich gehen. Das ist alles sehr umst√§ndlich.
7. Kritik wird grunds√§tzlich vom Personal √ºberh√∂rt, nur als es ums Putzen ging, hatte man ein Geh√∂r, aber  auch nur ein halbes.
8. Man kam sich so vor, wenn man "nur" Hotelgast ist, gibt es keinen bzw. kaum einen Service. Da k√∂nnte noch ordentlich dran gearbeitet werden.

Leider nicht sehr empfehlenswert f√ºr Hotelg√§ste. Bei Ankunft hat das einchecken lange gedauert, weil dort unterschieden wurde in Hotelg√§ste und Clubg√§ste.

content:
(Translated by Google) More gym, less hotel.
My partner and I spent a total of three nights in November 2018 at the Hotel Aspria Berlin Ku'damm. Unfortunately, I had to find out that the operator is more focused on the fitness club there. Service, opening times of the catering trade, as well as the structural arrangement of the facility are adjusted to the operation of the fitness club. To get to the hotel room you have to e.g. pass a turnstile, similar to the access control of a public bathing establishment. With a three-day stay this gets annoying at some point; especially if your own keycard is apparently programmed incorrectly and you have to ‚Äúdance‚Äù your name every time to get to your room. The reprogramming of the card always failed and the "dance" started all over again - also a kind of fitness ;-). To get to the actual hotel wing, you have to change the elevator and cross the spa area completely - somehow only suboptimal. The hotel bar closes at twenty-two o'clock, rather unusual for a hotel. The reception is manned 24 hours a day, but the entrance to the lobby is locked from twenty-three o'clock - I couldn't understand why that is so, when the night shift has the glass door in the direct field of vision anyway. The service seems to be hit and miss, from really friendly to unwelcoming, I've experienced everything in three days. At least one has managed to clear our breakfast table and fill it again within thirty seconds of absence, despite not yet emptied plates and cutlery placed according to etiquette - suspicious of a record ;-)
The hotel has a spacious wellness area on the fifth floor with several saunas, a steam bath, a spacious roof terrace and much more. Everything there seems a bit sterile and a bit restless, but outstanding compared to other hotels. The hotel rooms are very satisfactory. Unusually large, very clean, very modern, functional design. The half-open bathroom is a matter of taste, at least I liked it. Unfortunately there is no coffee capsule machine, which is actually standard in this price category. The hotel is in a quiet location, a few minutes' walk from the Kuhdamm, with excellent connections to local transport - ideal for exploring Berlin.
All in all, satisfactory, but not making you happy. Those who use the extensive range of sports will certainly get their money's worth. However, I am only evaluating the hotel operations here and there is clearly room for improvement. So unfortunately only two stars, sorry dear Aspria team, unfortunately, more is really not possible. The potential is there, but other hotels in Berlin are currently able to implement this much better.
best regards

(Original)
Mehr Fitnessstudio, weniger Hotel.
Meine Partnerin und ich habe insgesamt drei N√§chte im November2018 im Hotel Aspria Berlin Ku'damm verbracht.  Leider musste ich feststellen, dass der Fitnessclub dort eher im Focus des Betreibers liegt. Service, √ñffnungszeiten der Gastronomie, so wie die bauliche Gliederung der Anlage sind auf den Betrieb des Fitnessclub eingestellt. Um auf das Hotelzimmer zu gelangen muss man z.B. eine Drehkreuz passieren, √§hnlich der Zugangskontrolle einer √∂ffentlichen Badeanstalt. Bei einem dreit√§gigen Aufenthalt nervt das irgendwann; insbesondere, wenn die eigene Keykarte scheinbar falsch programmiert ist und man jedes mal seinen Namen ‚Äûvortanzen‚Äú muss, um auf sein Zimmer zu gelange. Die Neuprogrammierung der Karte ist dann auch immer gescheitert und der ‚ÄûTanz‚Äú begann von neuem ‚Äì auch einen Art von Fitness ;-). Um in den eigentlichen Hoteltrakt zu gelangen muss man den Fahrstuhl wechseln, dabei den Spa Bereich komplett queren ‚Äì irgendwie auch nur suboptimal. Die Hotelbar schlie√üt um zweiundzwanzig Uhr, eher un√ºblich f√ºr einen Hotelbetrieb. Die Rezeption ist 24Std besetzt, jedoch ist der Zugang zur Lobby ab dreiundzwanzig Uhr verschlossen ‚Äì warum das so ist hat sich mir nicht erschlossen, wenn doch die Nachtschicht eh die Glast√ºr im direkten Blickfeld hat. Der Service scheint Gl√ºckssache zu sein, von wirklich freundlich bis abweisend habe ich alles in drei Tagen erlebt. Zumindest hat man es geschafft, innerhalb von drei√üig Sekunden Abwesenheit, unseren Fr√ºhst√ºckstisch abzur√§umen und neu zu besetzten, trotz noch nicht geleerter Teller und nach Knigge abgelegtem Besteck- Rekordverd√§chtig ;-)
Das Hotel verf√ºgt im f√ºnften Stock √ºber einen gro√üz√ºgigen Wellnessbereich mit mehreren Saunen, Dampfbad, weitl√§ufiger Dachterrasse und vielem mehr. Alles wirkt dort etwas steril und etwas unruhig, aber im Vergleich zu anderen Hotels herausragend. Die Hotelzimmer sind sehr zufriedenstellend. Ungew√∂hnlich gro√ü, sehr sauber, sehr modernes, funktionales Design. Das halboffene Bad ist Geschmackssache, mir hat es jedenfalls gefallen. Leider ist keine Kaffeekapselmaschine vorhanden, was in dieser Preiskategorie eigentlich Standard ist.  Das Hotel befindet sich in ruhiger Lage, wenige Gehminuten unweit des Kuhdamms, mit bester Anbindung an den Nahverkehr ‚Äì optimal um Berlin zu erkunden.
Alles in allem zufriedenstellend, aber nicht gl√ºcklich machend. Wer das umfangreiche Sportangebot nutzt, kommt sicherlich auf seine Kosten. Ich bewerte jedoch hier nur den Hotelbetrieb und da gibt es deutlich Luft nach oben. Deshalb leider nur zwei Sterne, sorry liebes Aspria- Team mehr ist leider wirklich nicht drin. Das Potential ist vorhanden, aber andere Hotelbetriebe in Berlin k√∂nnen das momentan noch deutlich besser umsetzten.
Liebe Gr√º√üe

Emails are followed by an absence message - calls have been in vain for days. The announced mail regarding a new software required for the start is not sent. All in all: for a club that charges a monthly fee of more than ‚Ç¨130, the customer service is sub-par or non-existent. Exceptions are obviously individual employees who, if you reach them, try very hard. However, confirm behind closed doors that many members are right to complain about the untenable service. I canceled my membership today - because nothing fits together here anymore.

Die angek√ºndigte Mail hinsichtlich einer neuen, f√ºr den Start erforderlichen Software, wird nicht geschickt. content:

In addition, there are extremely excessive prices in the gastro (almost 5 ‚Ç¨ for a protein shake, 4 ‚Ç¨ for an undrinkable fully automatic cappucino). But what finally made me quit was the fact that the contributions for the closure during the Corona crisis are not reimbursed. This is - especially at this price level - simply a cheek.

The staff are in all areas (front desk, sports area and spa) very nice and helpful. Overall, I can recommend the Aspria, but for me personally for a membership is too expensive.

content:
(Translated by Google) First of all I have to say unfortunately: the price-performance ratio is not right at all in this fitness club.

The employees proudly advertise that Aspria is the most exclusive fitness club in Berlin. With many advantages that cannot be found anywhere else. You shouldn't let that impress you on the first tour.

Of course, to be fair, the benefits also have to be mentioned. These include: the handing out of towels, the modern design, the range of courses and the new equipment.

However, after regular visits, some weak points are immediately apparent:
- the room layout is super unfavorable. An example: to go swimming, you have to change clothes in the cabin and walk down two floors via the wet stairs (also past fitness rooms). On the way back it can get pretty cold. In addition, the sauna area has no direct access to the swimming pool. That means back in the cabin and from there up the stairs to the sauna.
- The fitness rooms are also on different levels. To get to most of the classrooms you have to cross half the club. It would be a greater motivation to use the entire offer if the premises were on one level.
- Paper towels and spray disinfectants are provided for cleaning the devices. I know moist disinfectant wipes in a box from other clubs. This makes cleaning more thorough and easier.
- There are only two to three drainage channels in the entire shower area. If several people shower next to each other, the whole drain will flow to one person.
- The water dispensers are small, slow and the water is sometimes greenish in color. In other clubs in this price range, there are large water machines with an extra bubble function.

In summary, the Aspria is a fitness club that needs improvement. With membership fees of this amount, a lot can be expected accordingly.
If you are looking for a studio that should motivate you to exercise, look for a club with a better floor plan.

(Original)
Zun√§chst muss ich leider sagen: das Preis‚ÄìLeistungs‚ÄìVerh√§ltnis stimmt in diesem Fitnessclub √ºberhaupt nicht.

Die Mitarbeiter werben stolz, das Aspria sei der exklusivste Fitnessclub in Berlin. Mit vielen Vorz√ºgen, die es woanders nicht gebe. Davon sollte man sich beim ersten Rundgang nicht beeindrucken lassen.

Um fair zu bleiben, m√ºssen nat√ºrlich auch die Vorteile genannt werden. Dazu z√§hlen: die Handtuchvergabe, das moderne Design, das Kursangebot und die neuen Ger√§te.

Nach regelm√§√üigen Besuchen fallen jedoch direkt einige Schwachstellen auf:
‚Äì die Raumaufteilung ist super unvorteilhaft. Ein Beispiel: um Schwimmen zu gehen, muss man sich in der Kabine umziehen und √ºber die Nasstreppe zwei Etagen runter laufen (, auch an Fitnessr√§umen vorbei). Auf dem R√ºckweg kann es dann ganz sch√∂n kalt werden. Dazu kommt, dass der Saunabereich keinen direkten Zugang zur Schwimmhalle hat. Das hei√üt wieder zur√ºck in die Kabine und von da aus die Treppe hoch zur Sauna.
‚Äì Auch die Fitnessr√§ume sind auf verschiedenen Ebenen. Um zu den meisten Kursr√§umen zu gelangen, muss man den halben Club durchqueren. Es w√§re eine gr√∂√üere Motivation das gesamte Angebot zu nutzen, wenn die R√§umlichkeiten auf einer Ebene w√§ren.
‚Äì Zum Reinigen der Ger√§te werden Papiert√ºcher und Spr√ºhdesinfektion zur Verf√ºgung gestellt. Aus anderen Clubs kenne ich feuchte Desinfektionst√ºcher aus einer Box. Damit f√§llt die Reinigung gr√ºndlicher und einfacher aus.
‚Äì Im gesamten Duschbereich sind nur zwei bis drei Abflussrinnen vorhanden. Wenn mehrere nebeneinander duschen, flie√üt der ganze Abfluss zu einer Person.
‚Äì Die Wasserspender sind klein, langsam und das Wasser ist manchmal gr√ºnlich gef√§rbt. In anderen Clubs dieser Preisklasse gibt es gro√üe Wasserautomaten mit extra Sprudelfunktion.

Zusammenfassend l√§sst sich sagen, das Aspria ist ein Fitnessclub mit Verbesserungsbedarf. Bei Mitgliedsgeb√ºhren dieser H√∂he, darf dementsprechend viel erwartet werden.
Wenn ihr ein Studio sucht, dass euch zum Trainieren motivieren soll, dann sucht euch einen Club mit besserer Raumaufteilung.

(Translated by Google) After five days at the hotel, I highly recommend this hotel attached to a gym and spa. If you're in Berlin and don't want to miss out on sports or a swimming pool or spa, then this is the place to go.

The hotel is modern and clean, the standard rooms are functionally furnished and very spacious.

The gym more than lives up to its reputation as a luxury gym. A comprehensive course program: from yoga to aqua gymnastics to HIIT and spinning, everything is included. The training areas are equipped with everything you need. The staff is friendly. There are fresh towels for free. Pretty awesome.

Das Hotel ist modern und sauber, die Standardzimmer sind funktional eingerichtet und sehr gro√üz√ºgig geschnitten.

Das Fitnessstudio wird seinem Ruf als Luxus-Mucki-Bude mehr als gerecht. Ein umfassendes Kursprogramm: von Yoga √ºber Aquagymnastik bis HIIT und Spinning ist alles dabei. Die Trainingsfl√§chen sind mit allem ausgestattet was man braucht. Das Personal ist freundlich. Es gibt frische Handt√ºcher umsonst. Schon ziemlich genial.
